unitName: Making America modern: Race, power and belonging in the twentieth-century
description: A series of powerful social, cultural, political, demographic, and environmental upheavals transformed the United States between 1900 and today. In this unit, we ask:  Who is American?, What does it mean to be American, and how has that changed over the modern era?. We will trace contexts and topics such as U.S cultural pre-eminence in film and popular music; the New Deal and the rise and fall of the welfare state; differing patterns of immigration and internal mobility; social movements especially those of the 1960s and 1970s including civil rights but also right up to "#Black Lives Matter"; environmental struggles; and the rise of conservatism since the 1980s.
